  • Field Details

    • audioPlayer

      private StockTickerAudioInterface audioPlayer
      This variable holds the reference to the audio interface that is used in the class for making sounds. This may be null if the system is not intended to make noise.

    • symbol

      private String symbol
      This variable holds the stock symbol. Should not be null.

    • stockQuoteSource

      private StockQuoteGeneratorInterface stockQuoteSource
      This variable holds a reference to the source for stock quotes. Should not be null once the system is setup.

    • currentQuote

      private StockQuoteInterface currentQuote
      This is the most current quote for the stock. This will be null until a successful refresh occurs.

  • Constructor Details

    • StockQuoteAnalyzer

      public StockQuoteAnalyzer(String symbol, StockQuoteGeneratorInterface stockQuoteSource, StockTickerAudioInterface audioPlayer) throws InvalidStockSymbolException, StockTickerConnectionError
      Parameters:
      symbol - This is the stock symbol that is being analyzed.
      stockQuoteSource - This is the source that is to be used to obtain the stock quotes.
      audioPlayer - This is the audio player that will make sounds. It may be null if no sounds are to be made.
      Throws:
      InvalidStockSymbolException - Will be thrown if the symbol for the stock is invalid.
      StockTickerConnectionError - Will be thrown if the stock quote source is null.

  • Method Details

    • getSymbol

      public String getSymbol()
      This method will obtain the stock symbol for the stock that is being monitored here.
      Returns:
      the symbol for the stock on the exchange.

    • refresh

      public void refresh() throws StockTickerConnectionError
      Get the latest stock info from the stock exchange.
      Throws:
      StockTickerConnectionError - Will be thrown if the routine is unable to obtain a current stock quote.

    • playAppropriateAudio

      public void playAppropriateAudio()
      This method will cause the appropriate audio to play back based on how the stock is doing. If the stock is up by 2% or more since the last close or by more than $1.00 since the last close, the happy music will be played. If the stock is down by 2% or more or by more than $1.00 since the last close, then sad music will play. However, nothing will happen if the audio player is null. If for some reason there is an error with the internal state, then error music will be played.

    • obtainStatus

      public final String obtainStatus()
      This method will obtain the status of the current stock, either RISING, FALLING, or STABLE.
      Returns:
      The return will be: RISING if the stock is up 2% or more since the last close or by more than $1.00 since the last close FALLING if the stock is down 2% or more since the last close or by more than $1.00 since the last close STABLE if these conditions are not true or UNKNOWN if the system is in an InvalidAnalysisState

    • obtainPreviousClose

      public double obtainPreviousClose() throws InvalidAnalysisState
      This method will obtain the previous close for the given stock.
      Returns:
      The previous closing value for the stock will be returned.
      Throws:
      InvalidAnalysisState - An InvalidAnalysisState Exception will be thrown if a quote has not yet been retrieved.

    • obtainCurrentPrice

      public double obtainCurrentPrice() throws InvalidAnalysisState
      This method will obtain the current selling price for the given stock, which is the last trade.
      Returns:
      The return value will be the last traded value for the given stock, otherwise known as the current price.
      Throws:
      InvalidAnalysisState - An InvalidAnalysisState Exception will be thrown if a quote has not yet been retrieved.

    • obtainChangeSincePreviousClose

      public double obtainChangeSincePreviousClose() throws InvalidAnalysisState
      This method will return the change since the previous close for the given stock.
      Returns:
      The change in dollars and cents will be returned.
      Throws:
      InvalidAnalysisState - An InvalidAnalysisState Exception will be thrown if a quote has not yet been retrieved.

    • obtainPercentChangeSincePreviousClose

      public double obtainPercentChangeSincePreviousClose() throws InvalidAnalysisState
      This method will return the percent change for the given stock since the last closing.
      Returns:
      The percent change for the given stock will be returned. It will be accurate to the nearest .01%. For example, 18.27% will be returned as 18.27.
      Throws:
      InvalidAnalysisState - An InvalidAnalysisState Exception will be thrown if a quote has not yet been retrieved.

    • obtainLastUpdateTimestamp

      public final String obtainLastUpdateTimestamp() throws InvalidAnalysisState
      This method will return the textual timestamp for the last update to this stock.
      Returns:
      The return will be the date and time of the last update to this stock quote in GMT.
      Throws:
      InvalidAnalysisState - This exception will be thrown if the quote has never been successfully retrieved.
